com.github.pwittchen.reactivesensors.library

Class ReactiveSensors

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.pwittchen.reactivesensors.library.ReactiveSensors

  • public final class ReactiveSensors
extends java.lang.Object
    ReactiveSensors is an Android library monitoring hardware and software sensors with RxJava Observables

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ReactiveSensors(android.content.Context context)
      Creates ReactiveSensors object

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<android.hardware.Sensor> getSensors()
      Gets lists of all sensors available on device
      boolean hasSensor(int sensorType)
      Checks if device has given sensor available
      <any> observeSensor(int sensorType)
      Returns RxJava Observable, which allows to monitor hardware sensors as a stream of ReactiveSensorEvent object.
      <any> observeSensor(int sensorType, int samplingPeriodInUs)
      Returns RxJava Observable, which allows to monitor hardware sensors as a stream of ReactiveSensorEvent object with defined sampling period
      <any> observeSensor(int sensorType, int samplingPeriodInUs, android.os.Handler handler) 
      <any> observeSensor(int sensorType, int samplingPeriodInUs, android.os.Handler handler, BackpressureStrategy strategy)
      Returns RxJava Observable, which allows to monitor hardware sensors as a stream of ReactiveSensorEvent object with defined sampling period

    • Method Detail

      • getSensors

        public java.util.List<android.hardware.Sensor> getSensors()
        Gets lists of all sensors available on device
        Returns:
        list of sensors

      • hasSensor

        public boolean hasSensor(int sensorType)
        Checks if device has given sensor available
        Parameters:
        sensorType - from Sensor class available in Android SDK
        Returns:
        boolean returns true if sensor is available

      • observeSensor

        public <any> observeSensor(int sensorType)
        Returns RxJava Observable, which allows to monitor hardware sensors as a stream of ReactiveSensorEvent object. Sampling period is set to SensorManager.SENSOR_DELAY_NORMAL.
        Parameters:
        sensorType - sensor type from Sensor class from Android SDK
        Returns:
        RxJava Observable with ReactiveSensorEvent

      • observeSensor

        public <any> observeSensor(int sensorType,
                           int samplingPeriodInUs)
        Returns RxJava Observable, which allows to monitor hardware sensors as a stream of ReactiveSensorEvent object with defined sampling period
        Parameters:
        sensorType - sensor type from Sensor class from Android SDK
        samplingPeriodInUs - sampling period in microseconds, you can use predefined values from SensorManager class with prefix SENSOR_DELAY
        Returns:
        RxJava Observable with ReactiveSensorEvent

      • observeSensor

        public <any> observeSensor(int sensorType,
                           int samplingPeriodInUs,
                           android.os.Handler handler)

      • observeSensor

        public <any> observeSensor(int sensorType,
                           int samplingPeriodInUs,
                           android.os.Handler handler,
                           BackpressureStrategy strategy)
        Returns RxJava Observable, which allows to monitor hardware sensors as a stream of ReactiveSensorEvent object with defined sampling period
        Parameters:
        sensorType - sensor type from Sensor class from Android SDK
        samplingPeriodInUs - sampling period in microseconds,
        handler - the Handler the sensor events will be delivered to, use default if it is null you can use predefined values from SensorManager class with prefix SENSOR_DELAY
        strategy - BackpressureStrategy for RxJava 2 Flowable type
        Returns:
        RxJava Observable with ReactiveSensorEvent
